segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, creating a huge puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's making me feel a bit disgusted that no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying that plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't noticed the water yet, it's quite disgusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, trying to get cookies without her knowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they'll get away with it or if she'll catch them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is a mix of chaos and calm, and it's a bit disgusting to watch the water overflow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want someone to turn off the water already, it's making a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's surprising how calm everything seems despite the disgusting mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit disgusted by the whole situation.
segments.speaker: PAR
